Package com.im.njams.sdk.settings

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.im.njams.sdk.settings.Settings
  • public class Settings
extends Object
    The settings contains settings needed for Njams

    All static final names of settings are moved to @NjamsSettings Please only use them and not the deprecated ones from here-

    Author:
    bwand

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static String INTERNAL_PROPERTY_CLIENTPATH
      Property added internally for passing an instance's client path to the communication layer.

      Properties filterAndCut​(String prefix)

      Return all Properties.They will be decoded because user cannot know which ones are encoded.

      boolean isSecuredKey​(String key)
      Returns true if the value for the given key is private and must be shown in the logs (e.g., passwords, etc).
      void printPropertiesWithoutPasswords()
      This method prints all Properties, but the values of all keys that contains "password" or "credentials" are changed to "****".
      void printPropertiesWithoutPasswords​(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
      This method prints all properties to the given logger, but the values of all keys that contain "password" or "credentials" are changed to "****".
      void put​(String key, String value)
      Put a key/value pair to settings.
      void reset()
      Reset the settings, which means everything will be deleted.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the settings, which means everything will be deleted.

      • printPropertiesWithoutPasswords

        public void printPropertiesWithoutPasswords()
        This method prints all Properties, but the values of all keys that contains "password" or "credentials" are changed to "****".

      • printPropertiesWithoutPasswords

        public void printPropertiesWithoutPasswords​(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        This method prints all properties to the given logger, but the values of all keys that contain "password" or "credentials" are changed to "****".
        Parameters:
        logger - The logger used for printing properties.

      • isSecuredKey

        public boolean isSecuredKey​(String key)
        Returns true if the value for the given key is private and must be shown in the logs (e.g., passwords, etc).
        Parameters:
        key - The properties key to test.
        Returns:
        true if the value for the given key must not be shown.

      • getAllProperties

        public Properties getAllProperties()
        Return all Properties.They will be decoded because user cannot know which ones are encoded.
        Returns:
        the properties.

      • filter

        public Properties filter​(String prefix)
        Return Properties, which contains only the properties starting with a given prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - prefix
        Returns:
        new filtered Properties

      • filterAndCut

        public Properties filterAndCut​(String prefix)
        Return new Properties, which contains only the properties starting with a given prefix, stripped from that prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - prefix
        Returns:
        new filtered and stripped Properties

        public void addAll​(Properties properties)

      • getPropertyWithDeprecationWarning

        public String getPropertyWithDeprecationWarning​(String expectedKey,
                                                String deprecatedKey)
        Same as getPropertyWithDeprecationWarning(String, String, String) with null as default value.
        Parameters:
        expectedKey - The expected (current) key.
        deprecatedKey - Deprecated key to try if the expected one does not exist.
        Returns:
        see getPropertyWithDeprecationWarning(String, String, String)

      • getPropertyWithDeprecationWarning

        public String getPropertyWithDeprecationWarning​(String expectedKey,
                                                String defaultValue,
                                                String deprecatedKey)
        Same as getProperty(String, String) if the expectedKey exists. If not, the deprecatedKey is tried and if found, a deprecation warning is logged for that key and the value is returned. Only if the deprecatedKey was also not found, the default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        expectedKey - The expected (current) key.
        defaultValue - The default to return in case that no key exists at all.
        deprecatedKey - Deprecated key to try if the expected one does not exist.
        Returns:
        A value for the given keys as explained above.
